• Home

Hi, I'm Matthew Woodward, a second-year student at the Georgia Institute of Technology earning a bachelor's in business administration with a concentration in IT management and a minor in computational data analysis.

If you would like to get in contact with me about a potential position, to view my resume, or any other inquiries, please message me at one of the below:
LinkedIn
Email (matthewoodward01@gmail.com)

Community Involvement

Being an active and helping member within my communities is something that I strive for wherever I go. Since high school, some of my most prominent community roles have been my achievement of Eagle Scout, my involvement as a tutor and mentor for younger students through 121-Reach, and my role as Events Coordinator Apprentice in the University of Georgia's Filipino Student Association.

For my Eagle Scout project, I built an outdoor learning area for Johns Creek United Methodist Church's preschool as well as restored a nearby walkway and multiple picnic tables to their original conditions. The project demanded approximately 80 hours of planning, leading, and communicating on my part and spent 9 months in development.

Interests and Passions

When I'm not studying for my classes, you can find me on the soccer pitch where I've been playing for over 10 years, on my computer studying the financial markets and investing, or at a cafe developing my computer science skills and knowledge.

I am a self-taught computer scientist who enjoys JavaScript, Swift, and HTML and building projects (such as the one you're viewing right now!) with those langauges to expand on my programming abilities. All of the programming knowledge that I have gained has been through independent study and a result of hardwork and dedication to broadening my skills.

Future Career Goals

Through my career, I hope to obtain a position which allows me to combine my passions for computer science and business. I believe that I would thrive as a data scientist or computer and information system manager, where I would have the unique ability to understand the goals of the organization from both the technical and business aspects of a situation.

Follow My Other Projects!

If you enjoyed this website, you can check out its source code and structure as well as more of my projects on my GitHub profile!
